alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Delaware (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:44PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Buchanan and northwestern Delaware Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 443 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Aurora, or 9 miles southeast of Oelwein, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Winthrop and Aurora around 450 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lamont, Masonville, Dundee, Manchester, Edgewood, Greeley and Oneida. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
